<small>Hebrew form: **<big>[[H0589|אֲנִי]]</big>**</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲנָא‎</span> [[Dan.2.8|Dan 2:8]]; [[Ezra.6.12|Ezra 6:12]]; [[Ezra.7.21|Ezra 7:21]] in common editions: see <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲנָה‎</span> below 

 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲנָה‎</span> **pronoun 1 singular** ==I== (= Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲנִי‎</span>, q. v.: Zenjirli, Cilician, Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אנךְ‎</span> ([[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>182; 104; 208</sup>; [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>oft</sup>), Nabataean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נח‎</span> . . . ([[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>221</sup>); [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אנא‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); — ***I***, [[Dan.2.30|Dan 2:30]]; [[Dan.4.6|Dan 4:6]]; [[Dan.4.27|Dan 4:27]]; [[Dan.5.16|Dan 5:16]], before a participle [[Dan.3.25|Dan 3:25]]; [[Dan.4.34|Dan 4:34]], after a participle ([[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 76, 2b</sup>) [[Dan.2.8|Dan 2:8]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןיַֿצִּיב יָדַע אֲנָה‎</span>, v[[Dan.2.23|Dan 2:23]]; [[Dan.4.4|Dan 4:4]] followed by a proper name [[Dan.4.1|Dan 4:1]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲנָה נבוכדנצר שְׁלֵח חֲוֵית‎</span>, v.[[Dan.4.15|Dan 4:15]] v.[[Dan.4.34|Dan 4:34]]; [[Dan.7.15|Dan 7:15]]; [[Ezra.6.12|Ezra 6:12]]; [[Ezra.7.21|Ezra 7:21]], as nom. pendens ['hanging' noun clause], [[Dan.4.31|Dan 4:31]]; [[Dan.7.28|Dan 7:28]] emphasizing a suffix ([[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 87, 3</sup>) [[Dan.7.15|Dan 7:15]]; [[Ezra.7.21|Ezra 7:21]] (compare [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>B 8, J 12, K3.5</sup>).
